instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does replacement display assembly have better flex cable?
threads.message: I have a customer debating replacing the display. I think it's a bad idea unless the issue is fixed on the new display. I've heard apple replacements have longer cable. Anyone have a source for display for ~$600ish with improved flex?
